subject: Critical Thinking
title: Kant's Categorical Imperative: Act As If It Were Universal Law
description: A quick, practical guide to Kant's Categorical Imperative: Act As If It Were Universal Law.

hook.text: 'What if everyone did that?' Your mother's question is actually Immanuel Kant's most famous philosophical principle.

buildup.text: Kant's categorical imperative: act only according to rules you could will to be universal laws for everyone.

discovery.text: Test: 'Can I lie?' If everyone lied, trust collapses & lying becomes pointless.

twist.text: The problem: Kant says lying is ALWAYS wrong â€“ even to a murderer asking where your friend is hiding.

climax.text: Kant's insight survives the edge cases: consistency matters.

punchline.text: If you wouldn't want everyone to do it, you shouldn't do it either.

quiz.question: What does Kant's categorical imperative require?
options: Act only according to rules you could will to be universal laws for everyone
